ca.eandb.jmist.math

Class Sphere

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.eandb.jmist.math.Sphere
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class Sphere
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A sphere in two dimensional space (the set of points at most a constant distance from a fixed point).
    Author:
    Brad Kimmel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Sphere EMPTY
      An empty sphere.
      static Sphere UNIT
      The unit sphere (the sphere centered at the origin with a radius of 1.0).
      static Sphere UNIVERSE
      A sphere containing all points.

        Determines if this sphere contains the specified point.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to check for containment of.
        Returns:
        A value indicating if p is within this sphere.

        public Sphere expand(double amount)
        Expands this sphere outwards by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to expand the sphere by.
        Returns:
        The expanded sphere.

      • expandTo

        public Sphere expandTo(Point3 p)
        Expands this sphere outwards to encompass the specified point. Guarantees that this.contains(p) after this method is called.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to include in this sphere.
        Returns:
        The expanded sphere.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Ray3 ray)
        Determines whether the specified ray intersects with this sphere. Equivalent to !this.intersect(ray).isEmpty().
        Parameters:
        ray - The ray to test for an intersection with.
        Returns:
        A value indicating whether the ray intersects this sphere.
        See Also:
        intersect(Ray3), Interval.isEmpty()

      • intersect

        public Interval intersect(Ray3 ray)
        Computes the intersection of this sphere with the given ray.
        Parameters:
        ray - The ray to compute the intersection of this sphere with.
        Returns:
        The interval in which the ray passes through the sphere (i.e., this.contains(ray.pointAt(x)) if and only if this.intersect(ray).contains(x)).
        See Also:
        contains(Point3), Ray3.pointAt(double), Interval.contains(double)

      • nearBoundary

        public boolean nearBoundary(Point3 p)
        Determines whether the specified point is near the boundary of the sphere.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to consider.
        Returns:
        A value indicating whether the specified point is near the boundary of the sphere.

      • nearBoundary

        public boolean nearBoundary(Point3 p,
                            double epsilon)
        Determines whether the specified point is near the boundary of the sphere, within a specified tolerance.
        Parameters:
        p - The point to consider.
        epsilon - The tolerance.
        Returns:
        A value indicating whether the specified point is near the boundary of the sphere.

      • normalAt

        public Vector3 normalAt(Point3 p)
        Computes the normal at the specified point, assuming p is on the surface of the sphere. This method is guaranteed to return a unit vector.
        Parameters:
        p - The point at which to compute the normal.
        Returns:
        The normal at the specified point.

      • smallestContaining

        public static Sphere smallestContaining(Iterable<Point3> points)
        Computes the smallest Sphere containing each of the given points.
        Parameters:
        points - The collection of points for which to compute the smallest Sphere containing those points.
        Returns:
        The smallest Sphere containing the given points.

      • boundingBox

        public Box3 boundingBox()
        Gets the smallest Box3 that contains this Sphere.
        Returns:
        The smallest Box3 that contains this Sphere.

      • getMatrixRepresentation

        public Matrix4 getMatrixRepresentation()
        Gets the Matrix4 representation of this Sphere. The Matrix4 returned, A, will satisfy:
        • xtAx < 0 whenever x = (x y z 1)t lies inside this Sphere,
        • xtAx > 0 whenever x lies outside this Sphere, and
        • xtAx = 0 whenever x lies on the surface of this Sphere.
        Returns:
        The Matrix4 representation of this Sphere.
